organization.title: Friends of the Earth Europe
organization.description: Friends of the Earth Europe is the largest grassroots environmental network in Europe, uniting more than 30 national organisations with thousands of local groups. We campaign on today's most urgent environmental and social issues. We challenge the current model of economic and corporate globalization, and promote solutions that will help to create environmentally sustainable and socially just societies.

score.title: Where does your MEP stand on fracking?

topics.title: Hydraulic Fracturing and Shale Gas
topics.description: Shale gas and other unconventional oil and gas pose a serious threat to the climate, the environment and local communities. The extraction of these fuels, like shale gas, leads to ground-water contamination, serious health impacts, and significantly higher carbon emissions than other fossil fuels.Friends of the Earth Europe believes that if these forms of gas and oil are exploited in Europe, our climate and renewable energy targets will be put in jeopardy and unacceptable risks will be imposed on communities and the environment.

votings.v_title: Europe-wide moratorium on the use of hydraulic fracturing
votings.v_description: Because of the adverse climate, environmental and health impacts and the gaps in EU regulation, hydraulic fracturing should not be authorised by EU Member States.

votings.v_title: Strict rules for hydraulic fracturing in Europe
votings.v_description: The report recommends a series of measures that would set very high standards for any hydraulic fracturing operation in Europe

votings.v_title: Mandatory Environmental Impact Assessment for shale gas exploitation
votings.v_description: Environmental Impact Assessments are required for the exploitation of shale gas and other unconventional fossil fuels in Europe

votings.v_title: Mandatory Environmental Impact Assessment for shale gas exploration
votings.v_description: Environmental Impact Assessments are required for the exploration and evaluation of shale gas and other unconventional fossil fuels in Europe

votings.v_title: Mandatory Environmental Impact Assessment for shale gas exploitation and for exploration when it involves hydraulic fracturing
votings.v_description: Environmental Impact Assessments are required for the exploitation of shale gas and other unconventional fossil fuels in Europe and for the exploration if it involves hydraulic fracturing

votings.v_title: Call on local authorities to ban the exploitation of unconventional fossil fuels
votings.v_description: Because the EU cannot decide on whether or not to ban unconventional fossil fuel exploitation or hydraulic fracturing, local and regional authorities are strongly encouraged to do so

votings.v_title: Call on the European Commission to include mandatory Environmental Impact Assessments for shale gas projects
votings.v_description: Calls on the European Commission to include mandatory Environmental Impact Assessments for both, exploitation and exploration, in the legislative work on shale gas

votings.v_title: Transparency for the chemicals used in hydraulic fracturing
votings.v_description: Calls on the European Commission to pass legislation for ensuring the highest possible level of transparency regarding the chemicals used in hydraulic fracturing
